title: AI/ML - Hardware Engineer, MI Neural Design
full_description: AI/ML - Hardware Engineer, MI Neural DesignSeattle,Washington,United StatesHardware+ 2+ years of experience working on ultra low power design + Proficiency in Python + Experience with FW development (C/C++) + Strong verbal and written communication and collaboration skills + Proficiency with Verification Methodologies, Environments and Best Practices. Understand and specify board level Requirements for FPGAs and low power CPUs. + Hands on lab bring-up experience, debug, and instrument usage + Experience with different sensors, particularly image sensor, microphone and IMU**Description**As a Hardware Engineer on this team, you will use your background to: - Build ultra low power hardware for AI applications - Come up with novel ideas to improve power consumption to fit the application requirement - Collaborate with multi-functional teams and understand requirements. - Articulate implementation choices, challenges and present results - Collaborate with multi-functional teams in order to define prototype hardware to evaluate new technologies and features - Do failure mode analysis, root cause diagnosis and system-level problem solving - Have hands on bench measurements of prototypes**Education & Experience**Bachelor's, Masters or PhD degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field**Additional Requirements**+ - 5+ years of experience working on ultra low power design + - Schematic capture and PCB layout design for mixed signal boards (Cadence, Altium, Eagle, etc.) + - In depth experience with FPGA platforms: Xilinx FPGA boards, debug, performance and throughput tuning + - Proven micro architecture development and excellent documentation skills**Apple Footer**Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity.
